Key Match Events: Alex Hales and Jos Buttler hit unbeaten half-centuries, with Hales scoring 86 and Buttler scoring 80.
Hardik Pandya's 33-ball 63 guided India to 168-6, but the total proved inadequate for England.
Virat Kohli made his fourth half-century of the tournament and put on a 61-run fourth-wicket stand with Pandya.
Chris Jordan picked up three wickets, including the wicket of Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav.
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler expressed confidence in his team's ability to win the T20 World Cup final against Pakistan.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England can now become the first team to hold both global trophies in white-ball cricket when they meet Pakistan in Sunday's final.
The match was a repeat of the 1992 50-over World Cup final between Pakistan and England, which Pakistan won.
Others: The match was played at The Adelaide Oval and will be followed by the final at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
